Privacy Policy for Audio Forensic Analysis App

Effective date: June 12, 2018

This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of collected data when you use Audio Forensic Analysis app and the choices you have associated with that data.

By pressing "I Agree" for consent button during launching/activation of Audio Forensic Analysis App, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions.

Information Collection and Use

We collect very limited information that is only required to do research about designing, testing audio algorithms. Note that

* The audios you provide may be collected and used by Audio Forensic Analysis App (name of app) according to its signUpRequest privacy agreement or terms of service.

* This app will collect and process the minimum required data necessary for our research tasks. Except microphone, data of no other sensor such as camera, GPS etc. will be processed or stored at server end.

* Additionally, data of no other application installed on signUpRequest\'s device will be retrieved or stored on server.

* No device specific personally identifiable information such as IMEI number, MAC address, or mobile phone number will be stored on our servers.

* Audio Forensic Analysis apps will not collect any kind of data in deactivate mode.

* Only data and meta-data of microphone will be collected recorded audio.

* Only recorded audio will be processed, stored and shared for research purpose.

* Except microphone, data of no other sensor such as camera, GPS etc. will be processed or stored at our servers. You may deactivate the device\'s location services

* No personal information will be sent to Web Server either for processing or for storage. Recorded audio and microphone metadata will be collected through this App.

* Audio recording can capture environmental sounds or human speech without any personal identifier information.

* Your confidentiality will be kept to the degree permitted by the technology being used.

* No guarantees can be made regarding the interception of data sent via the Internet by any third party.

* Data may exist on backups or server logs beyond the time frame of this research project.

Types of Data Collected

Personal Data

While using Audio Forensic Analysis App, we won\'t ask you to provide us with any personally identifiable information such as social security number, home address, etc., that can be used to contact or identify you ("Personal Data"). We will use manual filtering to remove any direct personal identifiable information from uploaded audio files.

Usage Data

* When you access the Audio Forensic Analysis App by or through a mobile device, this Usage Data may include following information: the IP address of your mobile device, and your mobile operating system.

Tracking Cookies Data

Audio Forensic Analysis App doesn\'t use cookies or other tracking elements

Use of Data

Audio Forensic Analysis App uses the collected data for various purposes:

* Since public IP address will be part of received packet, we will use that to classify the data based on City/State/country. No street address will be taken from signUpRequest or stored on server.

* Collected and manually cleaned audio recording using this App will also be shared with other researchers.

Transfer of Data

Your information, including personal data, may be transferred to - and maintained on computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ than those from your jurisdiction.

If you are located outside United States and choose to provide information to us, please note that remove your data from our dataset.

Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer.

Disclosure of Data

Legal Requirements

Collected data through Audio Forensic Analysis App may be disclosed in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to:

* To comply with a legal obligation

* To protect and defend the rights or property of Forensic Examiner

* To prevent or investigate possible wrongdoing in connection with the Service

* To protect the personal safety of users of the Service or the public

* To protect against legal liability

Security of Data

The security of your data is important to us, but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Service Providers

* These are not third party apps. The Audio Forensic Analysis App is created specifically for this study.

Links to other Sites

There is no link to other website or app from Audio Forensic Analysis App.

Children\'s Privacy

Only individuals 18 years of age or older can participate. If the subjects are not legal adults in the states where they live we will request a waiver of parental consent.

Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

We will let you know via email and/or a prominent notice on our Service, prior to the change becoming effective and update the "effective date" at the top of this Privacy Policy.

You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:

* By email: mahmood@oakland.edu

Terms of Use for Audio Forensic Analysis App

Last updated June 19, 2018

AGREEMENT TO TERMS

USER REPRESENTATIONS

By using the App, you represent and warrant that: (1) you have the legal capacity and you agree to comply with these Terms of Use; (2) you are not a minor in the jurisdiction in which you reside; (3) you will not use the App for any illegal or unauthorized purpose; and (5) your use of the App will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

You may not access or use the App for any purpose other than that for which we make the App available. The App may not be used in connection with any commercial endeavors.

1. Systematically retrieve data or other content from the App to create or compile, directly or indirectly, a collection, compilation, database, or directory without written permission from us.

3. Disparage, tarnish, or otherwise harm, in our opinion, us and/or the App.

4. Upload or transmit (or attempt to upload or to transmit) any material that acts as a passive or active information collection or transmission mechanism, including without limitation, clear graphics interchange formats ("gifs"), 1x1 pixels, web bugs, cookies, or other similar devices (sometimes referred to as "spyware" or "passive collection mechanisms" or "pcms").

5. Upload or transmit (or attempt to upload or to transmit) viruses, Trojan horses, or other material, including excessive use of capital letters and spamming (continuous posting of repetitive text), that interferes with any party\'s uninterrupted use and enjoyment of the App or modifies, impairs, disrupts, alters, or interferes with the use, features, functions, operation, or maintenance of the App.

6. Decipher, decompile, disassemble, or reverse engineer any of the software comprising or in any way making up a part of the App.

7. Use any information obtained from the App in order to harass, abuse, or harm another person.

8. Interfere with, disrupt, or create an undue burden on the App or the networks or services connected to the App.

9. Engage in any automated use of the system, such as using scripts to send comments or messages, or using any data mining, robots, or similar data gathering and extraction tools.

INFORMED CONSENT

ForensicExaminer: Testbed for Benchmarking Digital Audio Forensic

Title of the Project: ForensicExaminer: Testbed for Benchmarking Digital Audio Forensic

Principal Investigator: Hafiz Malik, University of Michigan Dearborn

Co-investigator: Khalid Mahmood Malik, Oakland University

Faculty Advisor: Hafiz Malik, University of Michigan Dearborn

Study Sponsor: National Science Foundation (NSF)

Purpose of the study: PI Hafiz Malik and Khalid Mahmood Malik invite you to participate in a research study about: The goal of this study is to design and develop benchmarking datasets for performance evaluation of existing audio forensic tools. The study is funded by National Science Foundation (NSF).

Description of Subject Involvement:

If you agree to be part of the research study, you will be asked to install Audio Forensic Analysis App on your smart-phone and record five audio samples of 5 mins or more and upload them to our data server. The Audio Forensic Analysis App will only use microphone of your smart-phone.

Benefits:

Although you may not directly benefit from being in this study, but society at large will benefit from this study, as digital forgery is growing and there is an urgent need to develop audio forensics analysis tools for forgery detection.

Risks and Discomforts:

There are no risks associated with this study because the data collection is completely anonymous, and the topic is not sensitive.

Compensation:

You will receive a $20 gift card for your participation in this study.

Confidentiality:

We plan to publish or present the results of this study but will not include any information that would identify you. There are some reasons why people other than the researchers may need to see information you provided as part of the study. This includes organizations responsible for making sure the research is done safely and properly such as the Dearborn IRB.

Storage and Future use of Data:

The audio data sets collected through this study will be stored on servers at the University of Michigan - Dearborn and the Oakland University.

Period of Retention:

Data will be retained for a minimum of three years after the conclusion of the award or three years after public release (publication), whichever is later. Data related to a student\'s research work will be retained for at

least three years after the degree is awarded. Data that support patents will be retained for the entire term of the patent. Longer periods will apply when questions arise from inquiries or investigations with respect to research.

The data collected through this study will also be made available (via University of Michigan DeepBule Library https://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/) to other researchers for other studies following the completion of this research study and will contain information that might identify you.

The researchers will dispose of your data by summer of 2023.

Voluntary nature of the study

Participating in this study is completely voluntary. Even if you decide to participate now, you may change your mind and stop at any time. If you decide to withdraw early, simply uninstall the App from your smart-phone and email Dr. Mahmood to remove your previously uploaded samples from our data server.

Contact Information:

If you have questions about this research, including questions about scheduling or your compensation for participating, you may contact

Khalid Mahmood Malik, PhD

Assistant Professor

Department of Computer Science and Engineering

532 EC 115 Library Drive Rochester MI 48309-4479

(248) 370-3542 (Direct Line)

If you have questions regarding your rights as a research participant, or wish to obtain information, ask questions, or discuss concerns with someone other than the researcher(s), You may contact the Dearborn IRB Administrator at (734) 763-5084. Written questions should be directed to the Office of Research and Sponsored Programs, 2066 IAVS, University of Michigan-Dearborn, Evergreen Rd., Dearborn, MI 48128-2406, (313) 593-5468; the Dearborn IRB Administrator at (734) 763-5084, or email Dearborn-IRB@umich.edu.

If you agree to participate in this study, please press "I Agree" button.

Do you agree to allow your audio data retention, please press "YES" button; you will be given an option to store electronic copy of this consent form for you to keep. If you would like to learn the findings of this study, please email me at (your email) and I will be happy to forward that information to you. Thank you for your participation in this study.
